item.title: European Arrest Warrants and the autonomy of public prosecutors as ruled by the CJEU
item.description:
Julia Burchett, PhD candidate at the Universit√© libre de Bruxelles and the University of Grenoble Introduction Widely recognized as a cornerstone of EU criminal law, the European Arrest Warrant (EAW) stands out as one of the most, if not the most, utilized tools for judicial cooperation in criminal matters among EU member states. This streamlined cross-border surrender procedure, designed for prosecution or execution of custodial sentences and detention orders, has replaced traditional systems relying on political involvement from individual member states...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/european-arrest-warrants-and-the-autonomy-of-public-prosecutors-as-ruled-by-the-cjeu/
